metadata.titleEn: The statistical cataset of families, genera, and species of vegetation in the Selincuo Lake Region (2012-2013)
metadata.description:
After three years of hard work, the cold region surface hydrology process study team of the Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research completed the investigation, sampling and identification of vegetation in the Selincuo Lake Region. More than 200 plant type specimens were collected, and more than 2,000 high-definition pictures of plants were taken. At present, researchers have identified 45 species of plants belonging to 23 families and 35 genera. Plant classification experts from the Institute of Botany of the Chinese Academy of Sciences were invited to undertake secondary verification and correction of all plant species names that have been identified. The plant resources of the Selincuo Lake region have been matched with corresponding diagrams and annotations. It has been professionally typeset, edited and published as a reference to relevant academic research of the region.
The Selincuo Lake area is a semiarid grassland with trees and shrubs rarely distributed, and the herbaceous plants species are also relatively rare in the area. However, vegetation plays an indispensable role in maintaining the integrity of the local natural ecology, wildlife habitat and production and life of herdsmen. The investigation results showed that the plants in the lake area were abundant in families, but with few species and genera of the same family. Among them, Compositae has the most species, subordinate to seven genera and eight species, namely: one species of Leontopodium, two species of Artemisia, one species of Ajania, one species of Saussurea, one species of Heteropappus, one species of Taraxacum and one species of Anaphalis; followed by Boraginaceae with a total of 4 species, all of which are of the Microula; Ranunculaceae has three genera and three species, one species of Halerpestes, one species of Delphinium, and one species of Thalictrum; Scrophulariaceae has two genera and three species, one species of Lagotis, and two species of Pedicularis; Crassulaceae has three species, all of which are Sedum; Labiatae has two species, all of which are Dracocephalum; Cyperaceae has two species, one species of Kobresia, and one species of Carex; Polygonaceae has two species, all of which are Polgohum; Caryophyllaceae has two species, one species of Arenaria, and one species of Silene; Gramineae has two species, one species of Poa, and one species of Elymus L.; Liliaceae has two species, all of which are Allium; in addition, there are 12 species of plants with a single family and single genus, namely: Stellera of Thymelaeaceae, Urtica of Urticaceae, Gentiana of Gentianaceae, Morina of Dipsacaceae, Torularia of Cruciferae, Potentilla of Rosaceae, Myricaria of Tamaricaceae, Androsace of Primulaceae, Astragalus of Leguminosae, Oxytropis of Fabaceae, Chenopodium of Chenopodiaceae, and Incarvillea of Bignoniaceae.

Concept Completion.Question: What are the challenges in identifying and classifying plant species in semi-arid grassland regions like the Selin Co Lake area?

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics and challenges associated with collecting plant species data in semi-arid grassland regions like the Selin Co Lake area?
Feature Specification.Answer: herbaceous plant species predominance, scarcity of tree and shrub species, low diversity of plant species, high number of plant families, few genera and species within families, Asteraceae family with highest number of species, limited genera like Artemisia and Taraxacum

Quantification.Question: How many plant species have been identified in the 色林错湖区 plant dataset from 2012-2013?

Definition.Question: What does '植物科、属、种统计数据集' mean in the context of botanical research on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Definition.Answer: '植物科、属、种统计数据集' refers to a dataset that compiles statistical information on plant families, genera, and species. In the context of botanical research on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, it involves the collection, sampling, and identification of plants around the Selincuo Lake area over a specified period, which in this instance was from 2012 to 2013. The dataset includes data on the number of plant species identified, their classification into families and genera, and the documentation and verification process carried out by botanical experts, resulting in the creation of a comprehensive catalog of the region's plant biodiversity.

Comparison.Question: How do the data collection methods for plant species identification in the semi-arid grassland region of the Selincuo lake area compare to methods used in more densely vegetated regions?
Comparison.Answer: In the semi-arid grassland region of the Selincuo lake area, data collection involved detailed plant surveys, sampling, and identification over three years, resulting in the collection of over 200 plant specimens and 2000 high-definition images. The region is characterized by sparse vegetation, with a variety of species but few genus and species per family. In contrast, densely vegetated regions may use more automated methods such as remote sensing to manage the larger volume and diversity of plant species and might rely less on exhaustive manual collection and identification due to the complexity of the ecosystem.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the challenges in identifying and categorizing plant species in semi-arid regions like the Selincuo Lake area?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: In semi-arid regions like the Selincuo Lake area, the challenges in identifying and categorizing plant species are influenced by factors such as the scarcity of plant species due to the harsh climate, the limited distribution of trees and shrubs, and the dominance of a few plant families with fewer genera and species. This results in a complex ecosystem where maintaining ecological integrity and supporting local wildlife and human activities are crucial, yet difficult. Additionally, the presence of numerous plant families with a limited number of genera and species further complicates the identification and categorization processes.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures and methods are used to collect and classify plant species data in semi-arid grassland areas for ecological research?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: Researchers conducted a thorough plant survey, sampling, and identification work over a period of three years in the semi-arid grassland areas around Serling Co Lake. They collected over 200 plant specimens and took more than 2000 high-resolution photographs of plants. A detailed identification process was followed, which involved consulting plant taxonomy experts from the Chinese Academy of Sciences to verify and correct the names of the identified plant species. The plant resources were matched with corresponding illustrations and annotations, professionally typeset, edited, and published as a reference book.
